title: System Administrator
content:
Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 6,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries.
With us, you'll find a diverse group of colleagues with different backgrounds and perspectives. We believe everyone has something of value to offer, and that sustaining a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace begins with fostering an environment where people can be themselves, authentically, every day. We want to build something with the potential to change the heart of our industry, and we’d love to include your unique perspective.
Description
As a SysAdmin within Media.Monks, you will be responsible for the maintenance, configuration, and ongoing operation of computer systems and software platforms. Working as part of a newly-formed IT team, your observations and input will help drive the evolution of tech administration within our company as we look to establish stronger policies, more security, better organization, and enhanced efficiency. As the needs of the IT team continue to grow, you will have the opportunity to learn new technologies and propose projects. Automating IT tasks will be a focus.
Additionally, as Media.Monks continues to integrate tools with newly acquired companies this role will have the potential to grow and be part of a larger team.
This role is well-suited for those who are self-sufficient, dependable, looking for new challenges, and are interested in expanding their skillset.
Please note that this role is intended to be an in-office position. Working from home part time, but also hands on work in our Hilversum and Amsterdam locations.
Responsibilities will include:

Install and configure software and hardware
Account management and auditing, including creation, deletion, and appropriate permission scopes
Maintain and monitor performance of platforms according to requirements
Troubleshoot errors and outages by running diagnostics, documenting problems and resolutions, prioritising problems, and assessing impact of issues
Plan and perform upgrades without causing unnecessary downtime for employees
Develop expertise to train staff on new technologies
Assist InfoSec team with configuring and testing systems for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures
Other IT-related tasks as needed

Qualifications/Background Sought:

3+ years experience as an individual contributor on an IT team
Experience running audits/reports and presenting findings
Familiarity with at least one scripting language
Experience in admin consoles of modern platforms; ideal technical knowledge includes administration experience with some of the following:
Cloud-Based Business Platforms: Google Workspace, Slack Enterprise Grid, Microsoft365/Azure, OneLogin.
OS: Windows server, Linux
Networking Hardware: Fortinet, Ubiquiti
Bonus points for experience with automation or APIs
Flexibility in working hours
An abundance of patience!
Detail-oriented and strong organisational skills
Strong verbal & written communication skills
Self-sufficient, proactive, and ready for a challenge

#LI-VL1 #LI-OnsiteAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 


Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems


Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
